June 15, 1957 D West of England Bandsmen's Festival (Class B)
West of England Bandsmen's Festival (Class B) 510 Test Piece Contest West of England Bandsmen's Festival (Bugle) west-of-england-bandsmen-s-festival-class-b
None
A Garland of Classics
Peniel Farm, Bugle, Cornwall, England, UK WEBF website gives Penwithick as the winners, but BB 22/6/1957 confirms that this is a mistake for Penzance.
March ('March of the Peers' from 'Iolanthe' - Sullivan, arr. Drake Rimmer): 1 Stenalees, 79 2 Bodmin, 77 3 St. Austell, 74
Best Player: 1 H. Rice, Penzance 2 D. Steward, Penzance 3 T. Humphrey, St. Ives
Jan. 27, 2013, 9:36 p.m. Aug. 13, 2013, 1:09 p.m.
1 Penzance Silver A. G. Richards
2 St Ives Town Stanley Coombes
3 St. Austell Town Band C. E. Brewer
4 Bodmin Town Band W. D. Lawton
5 Stenalees Silver Band John Harrison
6 Mount Charles Brass Band T. A. Cooper
